intro: Bupleurum pekinense f. chiliosciadium, commonly known as the Peking bupleurum, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the mountainous regions of northern China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features slender, branched stems and finely divided, pinnate leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of silky hairs. Its small, yellowish-white flowers bloom in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical study and conservation efforts.
